str2: A king, ruler, but in some passages clearly to be translated: emperor. Probably from basis; a sovereign.
Agrippa, i.e. Herod Agrippa II. Apparently from agrios and hippos; wild-horse tamer; Agrippas, one of the Herods.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: From pistis; to have faith, i.e. Credit; by implication, to entrust.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From a compound of pro and phemi; a foreteller; by analogy, an inspired speaker; by extension, a poet.

parse: Verb - Perfect Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
Verb - Present Indicative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: From pistis; to have faith, i.e. Credit; by implication, to entrust.
